The ChargeItem will hang off the encounter when it's provided. Hadn't considered how it would flow before that as yet.
It is intended to be the link between the clinical and financial.
As a Laboratory that does their Patient processing without a Patient Service Center should we still be generating encounters for every order whether or not they are going to generate a Claim?

Encounters are an aggregator for healthcare events. That aggregation can be useful irrespective of whether it's used to drive the claims process. Whether it's useful in your environment or commonly done by systems in your environment, you'd need to investigate. FHIR certainly doesn't require the use of encounters if there isn't a specific reason to use them.
